total_subquestions_ys: Q1: Identify the locations of the 3s in the input grid.
Q2: Count the number of 3s in each row and column.
Q3: Identify the locations of the 2s in the input grid.
Q4: Count the number of 2s in each row and column.
Q5: Create a new 3x3 grid.
Q6: In the new grid, fill the top left cell with the number of rows in the input grid that contain more 3s than 2s.
Q7: In the new grid, fill the middle cell with the number of rows in the input grid that contain more 2s than 3s.
Q8: In the new grid, fill the bottom right cell with the number of rows in the input grid that contain an equal number of 2s and 3s.
Q9: Fill the remaining cells in the new grid with 0s.

Q1: Identify the locations of the 3s in the input grid.
Q2: Identify the locations of the 2s in the input grid.
Q3: Determine if the 3s and 2s form a square or rectangle in the grid.
Q4: If they form a square or rectangle, determine the size and position of the square or rectangle.
Q5: Create a new grid with the same size as the identified square or rectangle.
Q6: Fill the new grid with 1s at the positions corresponding to the 3s in the input grid.
Q7: Fill the new grid with 0s at the positions corresponding to the 2s in the input grid.
Q8: Fill the remaining positions in the new grid with 0s.
